meanings.definition: To mark or brand with a hot iron
meanings.sent1: The rancher charked his cattle to show ownership.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith charked the initials onto the horseshoe.
meanings.sent3: The chef charked the steak with a special symbol for presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist charked the canvas with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition charked the family crest onto the shield.

meanings.definition: To make a sharp, abrupt turn
meanings.sent1: The car charked to avoid hitting the deer on the road.
meanings.sent2: The skier charked left to avoid a collision with another skier.
meanings.sent3: The bird charked suddenly to catch the insect in mid-air.
meanings.sent4: The boat charked sharply to navigate through the narrow canal.
meanings.sent5: The dancer charked right on cue with the music.

meanings.sent1: The teacher charked the student for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent2: The coach charked the player for missing an important practice.
meanings.sent3: The parent charked the child for sneaking cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The boss charked the employee for repeatedly being late to work.
meanings.sent5: The sergeant charked the recruit for not following orders.
